title: Applied Data Scientist
description:
description:
Help Build the Ultimate AI Assistant to Elevate Team Productivity with Cutting Edge Technology and Top Notch Talents! 
At Ask-AI, we're transforming enterprise employee efficiency with our global AI Sidekick. This innovative breakthrough tool boosts repetitive task efficiency, enhances knowledge management, and strengthens understanding of customer voices. Seamlessly integrated with major enterprise systems like Salesforce, Zendesk, and Slack, Ask-AI empowers employees with immediate, actionable insights from company and customer data.
The AI Sidekick is an always-on sidebar providing real-time AI insights into customer interactions and sentiments. It offers precise, relevant responses with a confidence score, addressing AI reliability concerns. Additionally, MosAIc, our AI insights tool, visually maps customer trends, aiding leaders in identifying and addressing emerging issues.
Backed by top VCs and a world-class team of AI and NLP MScs, PhDs, and Professors, Ask-AI is a trusted partner for leading companies like Monday.com, CallRail, Yotpo, HiBob, Own, and Instawork. Join us in reshaping enterprise knowledge and customer communication management.
We are looking for a passionate researcher to join the research department and help us develop breakthrough AI products and move the company towards becoming the next global AI Assistant for Enterprise.
Responsibilities
Be a part of enriching the company environment with innovation, collaboration, and outstanding performance.
Contribute to model and data development, delivery, and code deployment to production.
Engage actively with various teams to pinpoint business opportunities and tailor AI-driven solutions that align with customer demands.
Collaborate with other teams to bring research to production.
Work intimately with other teams to gather insights on user and business necessities and convert these into focused research goals.

requirements:
3-4 years of experience as a Data Scientist or NLP Researcher.
Experience in Machine Learning.
Expertise in Python programming.
Self-motivated and capable of independently managing complex projects with limited resources and competing priorities, while effectively driving company-wide strategic efforts.
Strong problem-solving skills, focusing on addressing complex technical issues, and a deep understanding of the elements that make products stand out.
Naturally curious, consistently engaging in critical thinking and questioning conventional practices to understand underlying principles better.
Excellent interpersonal skills and a team-oriented mindset are essential for achieving objectives.
Strong communication and leadership skills, with the ability to effectively motivate and manage research development teams.
Advantage - Worked in a startup and is comfortable in a fast-paced environment
Advantage - Familiarity with modern software engineering practices and tools.

title: Solution Engineer - Post Sales
description:
description:
Join our Team and help enterprise customers unlock the full potential of their data. As a Solutions Engineer - Post Sales, you’ll design, develop, and deploy custom solutions that integrate seamlessly with each customer’s unique systems and infrastructures. Working closely with senior stakeholders, you’ll translate complex business and technical needs into practical, scalable solutions that drive real value. Your work will bridge the gap between our cutting-edge platform and our customers’ ecosystems, ensuring they can maximize the data powering their GRC journey.

our story:
Anecdotes is redefining enterprise GRC for the AI era. We are the only AI-native enterprise GRC platform, built on a foundation of complete, accurate, and structured data automatically collected from your systems—trusted by some of the largest enterprises in the world, including Fortune 500 companies and leading auditors. By embedding AI across every corner of the Governance, Risk, and Compliance journey—audits, risk management, continuous control monitoring, and beyond—we’re turning a traditionally manual and fragmented process into a powerful, automated, and strategic driver of business growth.

what you'll do:
Design and deliver custom integrations for enterprise clients, leveraging expertise in cloud and infrastructure to build scalable GRC solutions. Partner with Security, DevOps, and Product teams to translate business needs into technical outcomes. Act as a trusted advisor, fostering strong customer relationships while driving innovation and expanding the Anecdotes platform’s value.

requirements:
2+ years of experience as a TAM / Solutions Engineer working with large enterprises in the Cloud Solutions space - 
Must
2+ years of experience as a Backend Software Engineer - 
Must
Strong technical background in Python or any backend language, using APIs, SDKs, and CLI.
Expertise in working with Public Cloud Providers (one of AWS, GCP, Azure) and all of their services, Kubernetes, etc.
Excellent interpersonal skills, with a talent for building lasting relationships and conveying complex ideas in a clear, structured way.
Bachelor’s Degree in Computer Science or other related field - advantage.
Experience in the space of Cloud Security / GRC - advantage.
Who are you?
Startup fit - thinks out of the box, quick learner, agile, and willing to go the extra mile to accomplish ambitious goals.
Comfortable working in situations of uncertainty where listening, designing solutions, and building consensus are required.
Excellent problem-solving skills and the ability to think on your feet, and solve problems during calls with technical customers.
A long-term thinker with the ability to design and implement procedures that will help the team fulfill its mission in the long run.
Open to feedback and lesson learning in short cycles.

summary:
As a Solutions Engineer - Post Sale, you’ll design, develop, and deploy custom solutions that integrate seamlessly with each customer’s unique systems and infrastructures.

title: R&D Team Lead
description:
description:
Your Mission
Scale the unique Anecdotes offering: The Data Engine, recognized as the world leading data collection & analysis infrastructure for the GRC industry. 
Your Role
As an R&D Team Leader, you will spearhead a dedicated R&D team responsible for our Data Automation offering, collaborating closely with our Product Manager and customer facing teams. Your mission is to drive the development and delivery of our extensive plugins offering, ensuring our customers can seamlessly navigate their tech landscape and meet their GRC objectives. You will lead the scale phase of our data collection engine development cycle, reinventing it with AI capabilities, collaborating closely with Data Scientists within the Data Engineering Group, and work closely with our customers to keep our product robust and highly responsive.

our story:
anecdotes is a B-round startup founded in June 2020 that is leading the Compliance Automation space for hyper growth companies. We believe that credible, visible, and actionable data should be the foundation of every GRC (governance, risk, and compliance) team’s decision-making process. That is why we help enterprises collect and standardize data from hundreds of SaaS tools, cloud infrastructures, private networks, databases, and more, to gain continuous visibility into their Security Compliance posture.

what you'll do:
Lead with vision:
 Mentor and manage a team of sharp, motivated engineers, helping them grow while pushing boundaries together.
Innovate: 
Identify and experiment with AI tools & techniques to bring an innovative mindset to our product technical design.
Own the delivery:
 Manage the development of hundreds of plugins and data artifacts across various tools, from Cybersecurity to Cloud infrastructure and Dev tools.
Partner cross-functionally:
 Align with Product, Customers, and GTM teams to bring seamless solutions to life.
Build for scale:
 Elevate performance and reliability while future-proofing the system with cutting-edge technologies.
Raise the bar:
 Enforce best practices in architecture, testing, documentation, and team processes.
Optimize constantly:
 Monitor team health, velocity, and outcomes to ensure consistent improvement.

requirements:
5+ years of hands-on experience in software engineering, with 1+ years in a leadership position.
Proven success leading teams in agile, fast-paced environments (preferably startups).
Deep knowledge of cloud platforms (AWS, GCP, or Azure) and high-level languages (especially Python).
Experience building distributed systems and microservice-based architecture.
Strong communication skills with a collaborative mindset.
A passion for building team culture and mentoring others.
A builder’s mindset with a sharp eye for efficiency, scalability, and simplicity.

our playground:
Anecdotes is a place where your ideas are heard, your contributions are valued, and your professional growth is a priority. Join us, and be part of a team that's not only shaping the future of GRC solutions but also redefining the way we work together.

summary:
As an R&D Team Leader, you will spearhead a dedicated R&D team responsible for our Data Automation offering, collaborating closely with our Product Manager and customer facing teams.

title: Product Marketing Manager
description:
description:
We’re looking for a
 dynamic and motivated Product Marketing Manager 
to join our team, reporting to the Director of Product Marketing. In this role, you’ll play a central part in shaping and communicating our messaging and positioning, with a strong focus on creating content that drives awareness, engagement, and conversion. You’ll collaborate cross-functionally with Marketing, Product, Sales, and take ownership of key go-to-market initiatives that strengthen Anecdotes’ positioning in the market. We are looking for someone with excellent writing and editing skills. This role is ideal for someone looking to make the move from content writing to Product Marketing.
Our story:‍
We’re anecdotes; a dynamic B-round startup founded in June 2020, who’s revolutionizing the Compliance Automation landscape for hyper-growth companies. At the heart of our mission is the belief that credible, visible, and actionable data with native AI capabilities should empower every GRC team's decision-making. Imagine a world where enterprises seamlessly collect and standardize data from hundreds of SaaS tools, cloud infrastructures, private networks, databases, and more. We bring that vision to life, providing continuous, real-time visibility into their Security Compliance posture. 
What You’ll Do:
Lead and manage product launches, partnering with Product Managers to define clear, differentiated value propositions for different audiences.
Apply your storytelling abilities to translating technical product features into compelling content that attracts, engages, and converts prospects: SEO-friendly web content, solution briefs, campaign messaging, blog posts, eBooks, webinars, and video scripts.
Conduct competitive research and track positioning shifts to help us stay ahead in a dynamic space.
Create and conduct enablement sessions for the customer facing teams and support Sales with high-impact materials that help accelerate deal cycles and improve conversion.
﻿
Who You Are?
2–4 years of experience in B2B SaaS marketing, with a background in content marketing that has worked closely with Product Marketing.
Strong writing and editing skills, with the ability to turn complex ideas into clear, digestible messages - you have experience creating high-quality content that drives business results.
Experience in using AI tools to enhance marketing execution.
Comfortable working cross-functionally with Product, Sales, and senior leadership.
Strong communicator with excellent project management skills.
Native-level English - a must.

summary:
as our Product Marketing Manager, you’ll craft compelling messaging and content that skyrockets awareness, engagement and conversion—guiding every go-to-market initiative across Marketing, Product and Sales.

title: Product Manager
description:
description:
Join Us as a Product Manager!
Are you looking to take the next step in your product management career and make an impact in the fast-growing world of Governance, Risk, and Compliance (GRC)? Do you want to shape products that help organizations streamline compliance and empower teams with data-driven insights? If so, we’d love to have you on our team!
Your Role
As a Product Manager at Anecdotes, you’ll play a central role in driving our product initiatives forward. You’ll collaborate closely with senior product managers, R&D, and cross-functional teams to plan, execute, and deliver features that directly impact our customers and business growth.
You’ll work on the 
Anecdotes Data Engine
, driving end-to-end data flows that collect, transform, and leverage information to power anecdotes’ platform and integrations. This is an opportunity to own meaningful product work while learning from a highly experienced product team.

Cross-Functional Collaboration

Customer Engagement

Product Communication
: Create clear and concise product documentation, feature briefs, and internal updates to keep stakeholders aligned.
Continuous Improvement

Have 
1-2 years of hands-on experience as a Product Manager

Bring 
prior experience in analytics, customer-facing roles, or software development
, giving you strong empathy for users and technical problem-solving.
Have 
experience working on B2B complex products

Familiarity with APIs, SQL, or software development is a plus.
Curious and analytical, always asking “why” and digging into data to uncover insights.
Organized and detail-oriented, with strong follow-up and prioritization skills.
A team player who thrives in a fast-paced, cross-functional environment.
Strong communicator in English, both written and spoken.
What We’re Looking For
We’re seeking someone who already has a foundation in product management and is ready to step up - someone who can 
own product areas with guidance, engage directly with customers, and partner effectively with R&D
 to deliver value.

title: We always look for great people!
Senior Marketing Designer
description:
description:
At Anchor, we are reinventing how businesses manage their revenue, freeing them from the burden of billing and collections so they can focus on growth.
Backed by top investors including Mosaic General Partnership, Zeev Ventures, Entree Capital, and industry leaders like Amy Banse (Adobe and ON Running), Tien Tzuo (Zuora), and former NBA superstar Andre Iguodala, we are making payments effortless so businesses can focus on scaling instead of chasing invoices.
We are looking for a 
Senior Marketing Designer
 to join our Tel Aviv team and take full creative ownership of how Anchor shows up in the world. Reporting directly to the Head of Marketing, this role combines hands-on design with creative leadership. From billboards and booths to websites, ads, and social campaigns, you’ll shape how our brand looks, feels, and resonates.
Our visual identity already cuts through an industry full of sameness. We are looking for someone who can elevate it further, build consistency across every channel, and continue to push into bold, unexpected territory. You’ll be the person ensuring Anchor doesn’t just look good — it looks unforgettable.
This role isn’t for everyone. 
We look for people who bring their heart, take ownership, and are comfortable figuring things out. These aren’t buzzwords; it's our code. It's how we work, how we hire, and how we show up. These are the people who thrive at Anchor and the people you’d be working with. If that sounds like you, apply, even if you don't fit 100% into the job description.
📍 
This is a Tel Aviv–based role, working 4 days a week from the office.
💜 
Applications must include a portfolio.

responsibility:
Brand & Creative Direction: 
Lead the evolution of Anchor’s brand identity across web, digital campaigns, print, events, and motion. Translate marketing strategies into designs that capture attention, build trust, and drive action.
Design Execution: 
Produce assets at every scale - from event booths to landing pages, social graphics, and ad creatives. Deliver final, production-ready files for both print and digital, ensuring flawless quality across mediums.
Speed & Agility: 
Work at startup pace - ship quickly without sacrificing quality. Iterate fast, respond to shifting priorities, and balance polish with speed.
Systems & Standards: 
Establish scalable brand guidelines, templates, and toolkits that keep Anchor’s visual presence consistent and efficient. Create processes that help the marketing team move faster while staying on-brand.
Creative Leadership:
 Set a high creative bar and ensure everything that leaves the team feels world-class.
Cross-Functional Collaboration: 
Work closely with marketing, sales, product marketing, and leadership to align creative execution with business goals. Balance aesthetics with measurable results like engagement, conversion, and brand recognition.

requirements:
6+ years of design experience, ideally with both agency and in-house backgrounds.
A portfolio that demonstrates expertise in both large-format print (billboards, booths, signage, stage graphics) and digital assets (websites, ads, landing pages, social campaigns, motion).
Mastery of Figma and Adobe Creative Suite (Illustrator, Photoshop, InDesign). Experience with motion design and video editing (After Effects, Premiere) and 3D/event mockups (SketchUp, Cinema4D, or similar) - a plus.
Strong understanding of web formats and standards, responsive design, accessibility, and performance optimization.
Solid knowledge of print production: CMYK vs Pantone, DPI, bleeds, and preparing files for different vendors and surfaces.
Proven ability to create design systems, brand guidelines, and repeatable workflows.
Strong grasp of marketing funnels and performance-focused design.
Experience directing and reviewing work from freelancers or agencies.
Hands-on, entrepreneurial mindset: comfortable switching between strategy and execution in a fast-paced environment.

description:

As we enter our hyper-growth stage, this is a rare opportunity to join an amazing team that is on its way to revolutionizing B2B payments

title: Product Marketing Director
description:
description:
About the role:
Lumenis is a global leader in energy-based solutions for Aesthetics and Eye Care. With more than 1000 employees worldwide and sales in over 100 countries, we are headquartered in Yokneam and have offices in Tel-Aviv.
We are looking for a Product Marketing Director, that will be in charge on the go to market of one of our leading product categories. 
If you want to work in an innovative, international environment and passionate to help push the boundaries of healthcare, well-being, and energy-based technology, this is your opportunity! 
Key responsibilities:
In this role you have the opportunity to:
Join a fast-growing company, disrupt billion dollars industry and improve millions of lives with unique medical device solutions. Your challenge will be to support the establishment of a new exciting business category in the US market in a challenging phase of aggressive growth and competitive environment. This role offers the unique opportunity to achieve a 360-degree view on go to market, product, marketing, and business aspects under the umbrella of a world leading organization.
As a Product Marketing Director you will own the marketing, product and business strategy and deployment of a winning new market category. 
 
Main Duties:
•	Own the go-to-market and marketing strategy and implementation of the assigned product portfolio across the different organizational functions and regional entities

markets.

title: Marketing Manager
description:
description:
About Us
Lumenis
 is a global leader in energy-based beauty and medical technology, renowned for pioneering innovations in the aesthetics and vision fields. We’re seeking a highly skilled 
Marketing Manager
 to join our marketing team. In this role, you will manage all our social media channels, digital assets, support product launches, and be responsible for business growth.
Role Overview
We are seeking a creative, results and data-driven Marketing Manager to oversee the execution of digital marketing efforts, ensuring consistency, performance, and alignment with brand and business objectives. This role is responsible for managing social media channels, websites, SEO, marketing automation, driving digital customer journeys, leveraging AI and emerging technologies, as well as immersive formats to expand brand reach and engagement.
Key Responsibilities
Social Media Management: 
Oversee our Social Media channels (Instagram, TikTok, Facebook, and LinkedIn) by maintaining a content calendar, creating engaging posts, and collaborating with doctors and influencers. Track performance and optimize content to enhance brand presence.
Digital Marketing Collaboration
: Develop and implement a digital marketing plan to drive brand growth. This includes managing and optimizing our websites and digital assets, focusing on user experience (UX), content, and SEO.
SEO Management
: Lead and execute SEO strategy, including keyword research, on-page and technical optimization, performance tracking, and collaboration with content and web teams to drive organic traffic growth and improve search engine rankings.
Content & Campaign Development
: Lead the creation and distribution of compelling marketing content and campaigns across multiple platforms to increase engagement and brand awareness. Manage and improve marketing automation, CRM engagement, and email campaigns.
Data-Driven
 
Optimization
: Monitor campaign performance and analyze customer data to identify trends and opportunities for improvement. Monitor key social media metrics, generate reports that show progress and optimizations.
Market Insights & Competitive Analysis
: Conduct market research, monitor industry trends, and analyze competitive activity to inform and adapt our marketing strategies.
Cross-Functional Collaboration
: Work closely with product, sales, and regional marketing teams to align global initiatives with local strategies, ensuring a consistent brand message across all regions.
Vendor Management
: Oversee relationships with external vendors, ensuring high-quality service and exploring cost-efficient options to enhance project delivery.

requirements:
Bachelor’s degree in marketing, Business, Communications, or a related field.
5+ years of experience in a marketing management role, preferably in a global or corporate setting.
Proven experience leading social media, digital multi-channel campaigns, proven track record of managing content development, SEO, and running successful campaigns.
Strong project management skills, with the ability to manage multiple initiatives simultaneously with strong attention to detail.
Excellent communication and interpersonal skills for effective cross-functional collaboration.
Analytical mindset with experience in using data to optimize marketing strategies.
Be curious and independent - eager to learn new tech and stay ahead of trends by conducting market research, identifying emerging technologies and platforms to enhance reach and engagement.
A creative thinker, you will work independently while collaborating across teams to drive impactful campaigns that position our brand as a leader in the tech space.
Comfortable working across time zones and in a fast-paced, dynamic environment.
Fluent English (written and spoken)
If you’re a Digital Marketer with a passion for driving global brand growth, we’d love to hear from you. Apply now to join our dynamic team and help shape the future of Lumenis.
Here’s why you will LOVE working at Lumenis
:
Develop your expertise and exercise your creativity while making a true DIFFERENCE in people’s lives.
Work at a company with a 60+ year legacy of groundbreaking innovation that remains a market leader in its domains.
Benefit from personal growth opportunities and drive decisions that shape the future of our products, processes, and business culture.

title: Technical Support Engineer
description:
description:
Blockaid is redefining trust in blockchain through advanced, integrated security. Our on-chain security platform is trusted by leading Web3 companies—including Coinbase, MetaMask, Uniswap, Backpack, Stellar, and others—to detect, understand, and automatically prevent or minimize the impact of fraud, scams, hacks, and financial threats.
We are backed by top-tier global investors including Sequoia Capital, Ribbit Capital, and Cyberstarts—firms known for supporting the most innovative and influential companies in technology and cybersecurity.
As the Technical Support L2 Engineer, based in Tel Aviv, you will have the unique opportunity to build and scale Blockaid’s L2 support function from the ground up and be a part of the Blockchain security future . Reporting to the Head of Customer Support, you will help our customers with their most pressing issues, protecting end-users from being scammed, creating real impact. 
This role is meant for a true builder. As the first hire, you’ll be a major player in building the support process for cutting edge new Blockchain security products, becoming subject matter expert and trusted advisor for Blockaid customers, engaging directly with our engineering and product team, and learning our product directly from them.
Your Chain of Impact: 
Provide expert-level technical support for Blockaid applications, diagnosing and resolving complex issues with aggressive resolution times.
Analyze sophisticated problems related to system performance, configuration issues, API integrations, Web3 security threats, and blockchain-related incidents.
Monitor system performance metrics, API health, and security incident alerts.
Serve as the primary point of contact for escalated customer issues, maintaining clear communication with stakeholders.
Coordinate with Engineering, Product Management, and Field Services teams to resolve complex technical challenges.
Identify opportunities for the support team to take on additional responsibilities and develop subject matter expertise.
Create and maintain comprehensive playbooks, troubleshooting guides, and internal documentation.
Develop tools and automation to improve support efficiency and reduce resolution time.
Maintain strict compliance with security policies and procedures, particularly when handling sensitive customer data.

requirements:
Your Chain of Strengths:
3+ years of experience in an L2 support role.
Solid knowledge of databases, query optimization, and dashboard creation using Snowflake, SQL, and data visualization tools
Strong understanding of cybersecurity concepts, threat detection, incident response, and security best practices in Web3 environments
Working knowledge of networking concepts, including TCP/IP, DNS, VLANs, VPNs, and network troubleshooting methodologies
Proven troubleshooting abilities, analytical thinking, and systematic problem-solving approach for complex technical issues
Excellent written and verbal communication skills for technical documentation, customer interactions, and cross-team collaboration
Applicants must have the legal right to work in the country where the position is based, without the need for visa sponsorship. This role does not offer visa sponsorship.
Blockaid is an Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, protected veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law

title: Product Manager
description:
description:
Who we are
Workiz is the leading SaaS platform for field service teams, trusted by over 120,000 pros. We help real, hard working people run and grow their businesses, with an end-to-end solution that enables them to schedule jobs, dispatch, invoice, track performance, get paid in the field, plus so much more — all in one place!
We’re on a mission to revolutionize our industry by “automating everything but holding the wrench”, providing our users with smart, AI-powered tools that will replace time consuming tasks, generate more revenue, and provide peace of mind, freeing our users to focus on building their small business into an empire.  
The opportunity
We’re seeking a talented Product Manager to join a brand new business unit focused on building a next-generation marketing platform for field service teams. In this role, you’ll have the opportunity to innovate, lead, and shape a solution that helps our customers run more effective campaigns, boost revenue, and significantly expand their business.
This role is perfect for someone eager to build from the ground up. You’ll work in a fast-moving environment where you can quickly test ideas, make an impact, and directly shape the direction of the platform.
If you’re a business-oriented, growth-hacking, product manager who loves to tinker, brainstorm, collaborate, and iterate rapidly, read on!

requirements:
Ideally, we’re looking for
3+ years of product management experience, including at least 2 years building and managing platform initiatives in the marketing space.
Strong business knowledge of how companies leverage tools such as campaign automation, lead generation, customer data, and analytics to drive revenue growth. 
Proven track record of managing projects from conception to launch.
Demonstrated success managing an end-to-end product lifecycle

Hiring process with us

Why You’ll Love Being a Workizer

Our workweek is flexible and hybrid

Excellent benefits
Team players. Rockstars without the ego. Fast learners that work hard and get S*** done.

40% female 60% male

description:
description:

This is a special place with a unique combination of brilliance, spirit, and just all-around great people. Here, if you’re willing to do more, your career can take off. We are a leading SaaS company for the field service industry, one of the most recession-proof and lucrative industries today. 
Workiz is located in the heart of Tel Aviv, just a short walk from the Hashalom train station. Our open-space offices can accommodate our 100+ employees and when we are not hard at work, you can find us relaxing with a cup of coffee on the balcony or surfing the TLV beaches. Workiz understands that you have a life outside of the office, so we have a flexible work week that allows you to work 3 days from the office and two days from home, but you won't want to miss happy hour!
Who are you?
You are a highly technical team player with a passion for transforming raw data into actionable insights that drive meaningful business impact. Own and manage Workiz’s ETL pipelines using Airflow and Python to load data into our data warehouse
Apply transformation logic with dbt to structure and align data with business and compliance requirements
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to define data requirements and build scalable business data models that support both internal operations and customer-facing use cases
Develop dashboards, reports, and alerting mechanisms using tools like Looker and Tableau to support data-driven decisions
Ensure data quality and accuracy through rigorous testing, monitoring, and governance frameworks

Proficiency in data modeling and solid understanding of Data Warehouse concepts.
Experience working with BigQuery or equivalent data warehouses (e.g., Snowflake, Databricks).
Working knowledge of Python for data manipulation and automation.
Experience translating business requirements into technical specifications and delivering actionable data solutions.
Track record of implementing best practices in data extraction, modeling, and dashboard building to ensure quality and consistency across the organization.

Experience with data visualization tools like Tableau, Looker.

description:
description:
Firefly is the Agentic Cloud Automation platform that transforms cloud infrastructure into a self-healing, compliant, and recovery-ready control plane. Its context-aware AI agents codify and govern your cloud, creating a unified system of record, acting safely and precisely within built-in guardrails.
We are looking for a talented Full-Stack Engineer with a Front-End orientation to join our R&D team at Firefly!
As a part of the team, you will participate in developing new features and maintaining our web application. You will face challenges of progressive features with complex design and write new APIs with smart data querying. 
If you embrace dynamic environments and have a solid understanding and deep knowledge of technologies and infrastructure - your place is with us.

responsibilities:

Work in a scrum environment
Develop and maintain robust, scalable applications using React, Node.js and Typescript Frameworks
Work in an environment leveraging MongoDB, Elasticsearch, Kubernetes, and AWS Cloud.
Participate in future product direction and technical brainstorming
Work with development teams and product managers to ideate software solutions
Develop and manage well-functioning databases and applications with effective APIs

requirements:
You should join us if you 
Have at least 3 years of experience as a Full-stack Engineer
Expertise in React and Node.js or Typescript
Have In-depth knowledge of JavaScript, CSS and HTML
Can be independent on one hand and a team player on the other

description:
description:
Firefly is the Agentic Cloud Automation platform that transforms cloud infrastructure into a self-healing, compliant, and recovery-ready control plane. Its context-aware AI agents codify and govern your cloud, creating a unified system of record, acting safely and precisely within built-in guardrails.
At Firefly, we are looking for a talented and passionate Backend Engineer to join our 
Core Engineering Team
. This team is the engine room of our R&D group, responsible for building the foundational services, data pipelines, and core algorithms that power our entire platform.
As a member of the Core Team, you will design and build our next-generation, data-intensive cloud solutions. You will tackle complex challenges in performance, scalability, and availability across multi-cloud environments, working directly with the massive datasets that fuel our AI capabilities. This genuinely unique R&D position puts you in charge of the entire development lifecycle for our most critical systems. If you thrive in dynamic environments, are fluent in modern programming paradigms, and have a deep understanding of distributed systems and cloud infrastructure, your place is with us.

responsibilities:
As a Core Backend Engineer, you will:
Design, build, and maintain highly scalable, low-latency backend services and APIs that form the backbone of the Firefly platform.
Develop and optimize the data ingestion and processing pipelines that handle vast amounts of cloud asset data from multiple sources.
Take a central role in our infrastructure and system architecture design, making key decisions that impact performance and reliability.
Collaborate closely with data scientists and AI engineers to integrate and productize machine learning models and algorithms.
Leverage the latest technologies to manage our high-performance, scalable infrastructure on AWS Azure and Google Cloud, using modern tools like Go, Kubernetes, and Elasticsearch.
Ensure robust security, monitoring, alerting, and reporting for our core backend services.
Work within an agile, collaborative scrum team and partner closely with our product team to translate vision into reality.

requirements:
To thrive in this role, you should have:
At least 4 years of production experience with at least 2 different server-side programming languages (Go one of them) - 
a must
.
Significant experience designing, building, and scaling RESTful APIs and high-performance distributed systems - 
a must
.
Proven experience working in a SaaS B2B company.
A deep understanding of cloud architecture (AWS a must) and modern system design principles.
Ability to take ownership and work independently with a "can-do" attitude and strong interpersonal and communication skills.
Advantages
AI & Data:
Experience building or maintaining large-scale data processing systems (e.g., using Kafka, Spark, Flink, or Airflow).
Experience working with Machine Learning infrastructure (MLOps), including deploying and serving ML models in a production environment (e.g., using Kubeflow, MLflow, Seldon Core).
Familiarity with vector databases (e.g., Pinecone, Weaviate, Milvus) and their applications.
Infrastructure & DevOps:
Hands-on experience with infrastructure tools: Kubernetes, Elasticsearch, and Logstash.
Proficiency with DevOps practices and technologies such as Terraform and Helm charts.
﻿
Databases:
Experience working with relational (e.g., PostgreSQL) and NoSQL (e.g., MongoDB, Redis, Elasticsearch, Cassandra) databases at scale.
